config.question: What did Germany promise to do under the Sussex pledge?

choices.content: to sink no more merchant ships
to not invade Belgium in order to attack France
to withdraw its pledge to support Mexico in obtaining U.S. territory
to continue its attack on merchant ships in the Atlantic

answer_3.response: On April 18, Wilson sent an ultimatum to Germany, stating that unless the Germans immediately ceased attacking cargo and passenger ships, the United States would sever relations. The German government yielded. In the Sussex pledge of May 4, 1916, it promised to shoot on sight only enemy warships.
